intro: Gomphia pubescens, commonly known as the hairy gomphia, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Restionaceae and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous growth habit. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves that are densely covered with fine, hairy structures. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically arranged in spikes. Gomphia pubescens is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
